司隸 Sili.text:
察舉百官及京師近郡犯法者

并領一州

Investigates and indicts officials, as well as those who committed offenses in the capital and nearby districts

Also manage the capital province
Third grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan , 1 person

蜀如漢制督察而已，不與州事
In Shu, the Colonel only conducted investigations as in the Han system, and was not involved in provincial administration

從事、史、假佐一百人；又有卒三十二人
A total of 100 Aide officials, Clerks and Clerical Aidesl; and 32 servants
In charge of reporting officials who committed offenses
In charge of promotion and appointment of personnel within the office
主督促文書，舉部郡非法
In charge of expediting documents and reporting illegal conduct in the local commanderies
Oversee all staff affairs, review and sign documentations

州 Provinces.text: 巡行所部郡國，錄囚徒，考殿最，每歲遣計吏詣京都奏事
Patrol the commanderies and states; inspect criminals; evaluate officials’ performance; and each year dispatches Accounts Clerks to the capital to report on affairs
五品，(刺史)六百石/ (牧)二千石，各一人
Fifth grade, (Inspector) 600 dan/(Governor) 2000 dan, 1 person per province

無加官者謂州單車剌史
Inspectors without additional titles are known as Single Chariot Inspectors

不入版圖者，亦置刺史遙領之
Territories not under actual control can also have Inspectors appointed to oversee in name

緣邊諸州剌史時與領兵都督並置
Border provinces sometimes appoint both Inspectors and Commanders

綱紀 Principal Officers

綱紀者，綜理府事，乃州郡屬吏之重者，常以指治中、別駕。
The Principal Officers coordinate the affairs of the office and are the most important among the subordinate staff of the provinces and commanderies, typically referring to the Administrative Aide and Deputy Aide in the Provincial office.

刺史闕則代守一州
Acts as the Inspector when that Inspector’s office is vacant
Accompany the Inspector on provincial inspection tours
In charge of promotion and appointment of personnel within the office
In charge of funds and grains
Major of the Front/ Middle/Left/Right Division
主督促文書，舉郡國非法
In charge of expediting documents and reporting illegal conduct in the local commanderies
In charge of education and moral instruction in the province
Oversee all staff affairs, review and sign documentations
每歲入京朝天子，對答州事，呈計簿
Every year travel to the capital to attend court, report on provincial matters, and submit the fiscal and census registers

郡 Commanderies.text: Assistant to the Intendant of Henan
In charge of the grains and animals used for sacrificial ceremonies

洛陽三巿，大巿名金巿在大城西，南巿在大城南，馬巿在大城東
Luoyang had three markets: the Great Market, also called the Golden Market, located west of the main city; the South Market, located south of the main city; and the Horse Market, located east of the main city
掌治民，進賢，決訟，檢姦，并舉孝廉
In charge of administering the people, employing the virtuous, adjudicating local disputes, investigating crimes, and recommending men of filial piety and integrity
Fifth grade, 2000 dan, 1 person each commandery

魏制太守皆加將軍名號
In Wei, Grand Administrators all had a general title

郡當邊戍者，丞為長史，掌兵馬
For commanderies near the border, the Chief Clerk replaces the Assistant, and manages troops and horses
In charge of troops and safeguarding against thieves and bandits
Fifth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

大郡或置二人，或爲東西部或爲南北部
Bigger commanderies may have 2 commandants, split into east/west or north/south divisions

綱紀 Principal Officers

綱紀者，綜理府事，乃州郡屬吏之重者，常以指郡功曹、五官掾、主簿。
The Principal Officers coordinate the affairs of the office and are the most important among the subordinate staff of the provinces and commanderies, typically referring to the Merit Section officials, the All Purposes officials, and the Registrar in the Commandery office.
In charge of promotion and appointment of personnel within the office
Oversee all staff affairs, review and sign documentations

門下掾

門下書佐

門下小吏
Responsible for ensuring the delivery of documents; also patrol and supervise subordinate counties

或有東西南北中部之分
Sometimes split into the north/south/east/west divisions

郡當邊戍者置
Established in border provinces with garrisons

國 States.text: Fifth grade, 2000 dan, 1 person each state

職如太守
Duties similar to the Grand Administrator

以下為王國公國屬
Below are the subordinates in Principalities and Duchies
In charge of troops and safeguarding against thieves and bandits
Fifth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person
Eighth grade, no fixed number of posts

惟山陽公國
Only in the Duchy of Shanyang
Eighth grade, 300 dan, 1 person each state

職如縣令
Duties similar to the County Magistrate

縣 Counties.text: 六品，千石/六百石，各一人
Sixth grade, 1000 dan or 600 dan, one person each county

大者置令，小者置長
Bigger counties have Magistrates, and smaller counties have Chiefs
Eighth grade, 300 dan, 1 person each county

千石令丞
Assistant to 1000 dan Magistrates

洛陽令丞三人
The Magistrate of Luoyang has 3 assistants

六百石以下丞
Assistant to Magistrates and Chiefs 600 dan and below
In charge of theft, banditry and criminal investigations

大縣或有二人，或分東西南北中五部各一人
In bigger counties may have 2 commandants, or 1 commandant per north/south/east/west division

惟都安縣
Only in Du'an County

以下為鄉官
Below are Township officials
Eighth grade, 100 dan, each township 1 person

十亭一鄉
10 neighborhoods make up a township

其鄉大者署有秩，鄉小者置嗇夫
Bigger townships appoint Stipendiary Township Officials, smaller townships appoint Bailiffs
In charge of adjudicating legal cases and collecting taxes
Ninth grade, 100 dan, each township 1 person
In charge of patrols and the suppression of crimes
In charge of safeguarding against thieves and bandits

亭所亦作通傳接待之用，漢制十里一亭
The local neighborhood station is also used to provide communication and reception services. Under the Han system, there would be a neighborhood station every 10 li (~ 4km)


漢制，通傳接待設郵、亭、傳、驛、置。名目各異，功用類似
Under the Han system, facilities for communication and reception included you (posthouses), ting (neighbourhood stations), chuan (rest stations), yi (courier stations), and zhi (roadside stations). Although the terminology varied, they served broadly similar functions

百家一里
A Village consists of 100 households

Head of Ten Households

Head of Five Households
